gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your scout warrior. May target a character, creature or vehicle at same or adjacent site for free. Draw destiny. Add 2 if warrior is alone and target is at an adjacent site. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.
lore: BlasTech sharpshooter rifle accurate to 500 meters. Corporal Janse brought several A280s with him when he left BlasTech.
name: A280 Sharpshooter Rifle

gametext: Deploy on table. When you fire two weapons (except lightsabers) in a battle, your total power is +5. Also, whenever opponent retrieves X cards, opponent must first use X Force or that retrieval is canceled. (Immune to Alter.)
lore: The destruction of a command vehicle negatively impacts Imperial battle efficiency.
name: Aim High

gametext: Deploy on table. You may initiate battles for free. Also, for either player to initiate a Force drain, that player must first use 3 Force unless that player occupies a battleground site (except a holosite) and a battleground system. (Immune to Alter.)
lore: Even though the landing of the stolen shuttle was successful, the Rebel strike team on Endor was forced to rethink their plans when Leia disappeared.
name: Battle Plan

gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your scout warrior. May target a character, creature or vehicle using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny > defense value. May fire repeatedly for 2 Force each time.
lore: Modified by Alliance armorers who defected from the BlasTech corporation. Expensive cooling system incorporated to allow higher fire rate.
name: BlasTech E-11B Blaster Rifle

gametext: Once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one artillery weapon or Portable Fusion Generator to same site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. May move Medium Repeating Blaster Cannon by himself (for free).
lore: \b Scout\b0  and heavy weapons specialist. Carries custom repulsorlift compensators to allow fluid movement with light artillery weapons.
name: Captain Yutani

gametext: USED: If a battle was just initiated, draw destiny and activate up to that much Force. STARTING: If you have not deployed an Objective, deploy from Reserve Deck one battleground site (or two <> sites) related to your starting location. Place Interrupt in Reserve Deck.
lore: Alliance troops on planet must plan ahead to achieve success in military operations.
name: Careful Planning

dark_side_text: If you control with two Star Destroyers, Force drain +1 here. If you control with no capital starships, Force drain -1 here.
gametext: If you occupy with a capital starship, Force generation +2 for you here. Mon Mothma deploys -2 at any Chandrila location.   If you control with two Star Destroyers, Force drain +1 here. If you control with no capital starships, Force drain -1 here.
light_side_text: If you occupy with a capital starship, Force generation +2 for you here. Mon Mothma deploys -2 at any Chandrila location.
name: Chandrila

gametext: Deploys -2 on Endor. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When targeted by a weapon, may 'roar' (defense value = 4). When on Endor during your deploy phase, may deploy Lumat and/or Wuta for free here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
lore: Wookiee \b scout\b0. Volunteered for Han's Endor strike team. Keeps his distance, but doesn't look like he's keeping his distance. Always thinks with his stomach.
name: Chewbacca Of Kashyyyk

gametext: Deploy on Chewie, or use 4 Force to deploy on your other Wookiee. May target a character, creature or vehicle using 3 Force (for free if Chewie firing). Draw two destiny. Target hit if total destiny > defense value. If hit by Chewie, target's forfeit = 0.
lore: Specially modified by Chewbacca. Fires larger bolts with more accuracy. Superior targeting at long distances.
name: Chewbacca's Bowcaster

gametext: Deploy only to Endor or same site as Chewie or opponent's AT-ST. May add 2 pilots or passengers. Subtracts 1 from power of other AT-STs at same site. Immune to attrition < 4 when Chewie piloting.
lore: \b Enclosed\b0. Chewie's daring capture of an Imperial AT-ST helped turn the tide in the Battle of Endor.
name: Chewie's AT-ST

gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each (Light Side Force icon) at same Endor site. Once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one non-unique Ewok to same Endor site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
lore: \b Leader\b0  of Wicket's Ewok tribe for 42 seasons. Head of the Council of Elders. Decided to spare Han's Rebels and join their fight against the Empire.
name: Chief Chirpa

gametext: Deploy on your side of table. Each of your non-unique Rebels armed with a non-unique blaster is forfeit +2, adds 1 to his total weapon destiny and, where present, cumulatively adds 1 to total battle destiny. (Immune to Alter while your non-unique blaster is on table.)
lore: Han's Rebel strike team on the forest moon of Endor was highly trained in the use of blasters and explosives.
name: Commando Training

gametext: Prevents opponent from 'reacting' to same site. Once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one device to same location from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Rebels of ability < 3 and [Endor] Rebels are immune to Scanning Crew.
lore: Alderaan slicer and technician. Trained by Brooks Carlson to serve as a \b scout\b0  for Alliance commandos. She gets nervous when General Solo tries to hotwire something.
name: Corporal Beezer

gametext: Prevents your characters from having their forfeit reduced at same location (and at Hoth sites if Delevar is at Echo Med Lab). When with your FX droid, once per turn allows your character just forfeited from same site to be placed in Used Pile.
lore: Veteran of Battle of Hoth. Medic and \b scout\b0  assigned to General Solo's assault force. Prides himself on being an efficient soldier in General Madine's commando organization.
name: Corporal Delevar

gametext: When firing a character weapon, adds 1 to each weapon destiny draw. When Janse fires an A280 Sharpshooter Rifle at a character at an adjacent site and is using Sorry About The Mess, it is a Used Interrupt.
lore: Sharpshooter from Ukio. Recently joined the Alliance. Former BlasTech employee who evaluated new weapon designs. Served as a \b scout\b0  on hunting expeditions.
name: Corporal Janse

gametext: When present at an exterior battleground site with your other scout, adds 2 (or 1 if Goo Nee Tay on table) to deploy cost of opponent's characters, vehicles and starships to same site.
lore: \b Scout\b0  responsible for covering the tracks of General Solo's strike team. Served under Bren Derlin during the Battle of Hoth.
name: Corporal Kensaric

gametext: Deploy on Leia if That's One is on table. I Know is a Used Interrupt. Once per battle, when Leia is battling with Han and Chewie and you are about to draw a card for battle or weapon destiny, you may instead use Leia's ability number.
lore: Leia couldn't let Han out of her sight.
name: Count Me In

gametext: USED: If your shuttle (including a shuttle vehicle) is in battle, add one battle destiny. LOST: If your starfighter just landed at a site where opponent has no presence, deploy scouts (and weapons on those scouts) aboard it (capacity permitting) from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
lore: The stolen code allowed the Rebels to land their strike team on Endor surface undetected -- or so they thought.
name: Covert Landing

gametext: Deploys -3 on \ul Tydirium\ul0, Endor or Dagobah. May be targeted instead of Luke by Mind What You Have Learned (that card then targets Leia instead of Luke for remainder of game). While at any exterior site, adds one (Light Side Force icon). Immune to attrition < 4.
lore: \b Scout\b0. \b Leader\b0. Made friends with Wicket. Negotiated an alliance with the Ewoks. Leia found out the truth about her father from Luke in the Ewok village.
name: Daughter Of Skywalker

gametext: Deploy on Bunker. During your control phase, if you control Bunker with a Rebel, you may attempt to "blow away" Bunker as follows:\par \b Charges! Come On, Come On!\b0: Draw two destiny. Add 3 to total for each Explosive Charge on Bunker.\par \b Move! Move! Move!\b0: If total destiny > 12, your characters here may relocate to Back Door for free, Bunker and Landing Platform (if on table) are "blown away," opponent loses 8 Force and this card is lost.
name: Deactivate The Shield Generator

gametext: Power +1 when at a forest, jungle or exterior Endor site. When in battle at an exterior site against a non-unique alien, adds one destiny to total power only, prevents opponent from drawing more than one battle destiny and is immune to attrition < 4.
lore: Dresselians combat their homeworld's subjugation with supplies provided by Bothans. The Alliance uses their talents as resistance fighters. These \b scouts\b0  prefer to work alone.
name: Dresselian Commando

dark_side_text: If you have no Imperials on Endor, Force drain -1 here.
gametext: Force drain -1 here. To move your starship here from Sullust, Rendezvous Point or Haven requires -1 Force.   If you have no Imperials on Endor, Force drain -1 here.
light_side_text: Force drain -1 here. To move your starship here from Sullust, Rendezvous Point or Haven requires -1 Force.
name: Endor

gametext: Cancel Tatooine Occupation, Cloud City Occupation or Rebel Base Occupation. (Immune to Sense.) OR During your activate phase, activate 1 Force for each Endor battleground you occupy.
lore: The Rebel presence on Endor meant that the Ewoks would be able to live free from the Empire's tyranny.
name: Endor Celebration

gametext: Power -1 while not on Endor. While Endor Scout Tooper is on Endor, Lieutenant Page and each of your Rebel scouts of ability < 3 at same and adjacent exterior sites are immune to attrition < 2.
lore: Rebel troopers receive \b scout\b0  training that helps them to survive combat in harsh environments. Often protect 'specialists' while they accomplish mission tasks.
name: Endor Scout Trooper

dark_side_text: If you control, during your move phase, you may move from Back Door to Bunker (or vice versa).
gametext: During your move phase, you may move from Back Door to Bunker (or vice versa).   If you control, during your move phase, you may move from Back Door to Bunker (or vice versa).
light_side_text: During your move phase, you may move from Back Door to Bunker (or vice versa).
name: Endor: Back Door

dark_side_text: Once per game, you may deploy Endor Shield from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
gametext: Force drain +1 here. If you initiate a battle here, add one battle destiny.   Once per game, you may deploy Endor Shield from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
light_side_text: Force drain +1 here. If you initiate a battle here, add one battle destiny.
name: Endor: Bunker

dark_side_text: If you control Chief Chirpa's Hut, Ewoks at Endor sites are forfeit -1.
gametext: Your Ewoks are deploy -1 here. Chief Chirpa deploys free here.   If you control Chief Chirpa's Hut, Ewoks at Endor sites are forfeit -1.
light_side_text: Your Ewoks are deploy -1 here. Chief Chirpa deploys free here.
name: Endor: Chief Chirpa's Hut

dark_side_text: No starships or vehicles here except speeder bikes, AT-STs, Ewok gliders and creature vehicles.
gametext: No starships or vehicles here except speeder bikes, AT-STs, Ewok gliders and creature vehicles.   No starships or vehicles here except speeder bikes, AT-STs, Ewok gliders and creature vehicles.
light_side_text: No starships or vehicles here except speeder bikes, AT-STs, Ewok gliders and creature vehicles.
name: Endor: Dense Forest

dark_side_text: No starships or vehicles here. If no Ewoks on Endor, Force drain +1 here.
gametext: No starships or vehicles here. Ewok devices and Ewok weapons deploy -1 here.   No starships or vehicles here. If no Ewoks on Endor, Force drain +1 here.
light_side_text: No starships or vehicles here. Ewok devices and Ewok weapons deploy -1 here.
name: Endor: Ewok Village

dark_side_text: Your character movement from here (except for Yuzzum and scouts) requires +1 landspeed.
gametext: Your character movement from here (except for Ewoks and scouts) requires +1 landspeed.   Your character movement from here (except for Yuzzum and scouts) requires +1 landspeed.
light_side_text: Your character movement from here (except for Ewoks and scouts) requires +1 landspeed.
name: Endor: Great Forest

dark_side_text: If you occupy, opponent's Hidden Forest Trail game text is canceled.
gametext: During your move phase, your scouts may move between here and any exterior Endor site.   If you occupy, opponent's Hidden Forest Trail game text is canceled.
light_side_text: During your move phase, your scouts may move between here and any exterior Endor site.
name: Endor: Hidden Forest Trail

dark_side_text: Your docking bay transit from here requires 1 Force (free if your Imperial present).
gametext: Your docking bay transit from here requires 2 Force.   Your docking bay transit from here requires 1 Force (free if your Imperial present).
light_side_text: Your docking bay transit from here requires 2 Force.
name: Endor: Landing Platform (Docking Bay)

dark_side_text: If you occupy, opponent's Rebel Landing Site game text is canceled.
gametext: Your starfighters land here for free. Your droids and [Endor] Rebels are deploy -1 here.   If you occupy, opponent's Rebel Landing Site game text is canceled.
light_side_text: Your starfighters land here for free. Your droids and [Endor] Rebels are deploy -1 here.
name: Endor: Rebel Landing Site (Forest)

gametext: If opponent's creature vehicle or AT-ST just deployed or moved to where your Ewok is present, draw destiny. Creature vehicle lost if destiny > defense value. AT-ST crashed if destiny +2 > armor. OR If your Ewok is defending a battle, add 2 to your total power.
lore: Even an All Terrain Scout Transport cannot stand on all terrain.
name: Ewok And Roll

gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your Ewok. May target a character or creature using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Add 1 for each other Ewok present who is armed with an Ewok Bow. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.
lore: Primitive weapon. Effective in large volleys. Imperial troops are not prepared for such simple tactics.
name: Ewok Bow

gametext: Deploy on an exterior Endor site. Does not require a power source. Your Ewok present may target a vehicle with armor at same or adjacent site for free. Draw destiny. Add 1 for each Ewok present. Target crashes if total destiny > defense value.
lore: Crowning achievement of Chirpa's engineers. Heavy stones from these weapons distracted Imperial AT-ST walkers.
name: Ewok Catapult

gametext: May add 1 driver (must be an Ewok). Once per turn, when in battle, may target a character or creature present. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny -1 > defense value.
lore: Primitive flying vehicle used by Ewoks. Used to drop rocks on Imperial troops during the Battle of Endor.
name: Ewok Glider

gametext: If opponent's transport vehicle or AT-ST just deployed or moved to an Endor site, draw destiny. Add 1 for each of your Ewoks present. Vehicle lost if destiny - 1 > defense value. OR Lose 1 Force to take into hand a card you just drew for battle or weapon destiny.
lore: Any problem can be solved by the proper application of the principles of mass and velocity.
name: Ewok Log Jam

gametext: If your Ewok is present with an escorted captive, draw destiny. Add 2 if Ewok is a scout. If total destiny > escort's defense value, captive is released. OR If your Ewok is defending a battle, up to three of your Ewoks at one exterior site may move as a 'react' (for free).
lore: Ewoks used superior knowledge of Endor's forested terrain to free commandos captured by Imperial stormtroopers.
name: Ewok Rescue

gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each (Light Side Force icon) at same Endor site. May deploy as a 'react.' May move as a 'react' (for free) to a battle where you have a unique (*) Ewok.
lore: Ewok sentries \b scout\b0  the perimeter of their domain. Their watchful eyes search for both predatory animals and invading stormtroopers.
name: Ewok Sentry

gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your Ewok (free on Ewok Spearman). Adds 1 to power. May target a character or creature using 1 Force. Both players draw destiny. Target's power or ferocity = 0 for remainder of turn if your destiny + Ewok's power > opponent's destiny.
lore: Chosen weapon of most Ewok warriors. Pointed tip made of stone or animal horn.
name: Ewok Spear

gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each (Light Side Force icon) at same Endor site. When on Endor and present with any other Ewok, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
lore: Ewok fighters train with primitive weapons. Their bravery and careful aim helped defeat the Imperial troops during the Battle of Endor.
name: Ewok Spearman

gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each (Light Side Force icon) at same Endor site. When forfeited at same site as your Ewok of ability > 1, may satisfy all remaining attrition against you.
lore: Members of Chief Chirpa's Ewok tribe are courageous in battle. They seek to impress older members of the tribe.
name: Ewok Tribesman

gametext: Deploy on an interior planet site you occupy. Immune to Overload. Place in Used Pile if opponent controls this site. If you just lost a battle opponent initiated here, may draw destiny. All cards (except Effects) here are lost if destiny > 4 (otherwise, Charge lost).
lore: Standard explosive charge carried by Rebel commandos. When used in multiple, these charges have the explosive capacity to level a heavily armored structure.
name: Explosive Charge

gametext: During a battle, if you have weapons at at least 2 sites adjacent to that battle, add 3 to your total power and add one battle destiny. OR For remainder of turn, your scout at an exterior site is power +1 and adds 1 to each of that character's weapon destiny draws.
lore: Lieutenant Page effectively deployed his attachment of Rebel commandos during the attack at the control bunker.
name: Firefight

gametext: USED: Cancel Early Warning Network or It's An Older Code. OR During your deploy phase, deploy one starship (deploy -1) and/or one pilot to a system even without presence or Force icons. LOST: Take one \ul Tydirium\ul0  or \ul Tantive IV\ul0  into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
lore: As a smuggler, Han had years of experience at avoiding Imperial detection. He chose the approach to Endor's moon as the time to pass some of that knowledge on to Chewie.
name: Fly Casual

gametext: If you control a location where opponent has a speeder bike, AT-ST or skiff, steal that vehicle (any characters aboard are lost). OR Peek at one card randomly selected from opponent's hand. If that card is a speeder bike, AT-ST or skiff, steal it into hand.
lore: To prevent biker scouts from reaching their base, Luke and Leia "borrowed" some nearby transportation.
name: Free Ride

gametext: Once during each of your deploy phases, may take one scout of ability < 3 into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While at your war room or aboard your capital starship, adds 1 to immunity to attrition of all your scouts who have immunity.
lore: Military advisor to Mon Mothma. \b Leader\b0  of commando project. Corellian native. Defected to the Alliance shortly after the Battle of Yavin. Rescued by Rogue Squadron.
name: General Crix Madine

gametext: Deploys -2 on \ul Falcon\ul0, \ul Tydirium\ul0  or Endor. Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When in battle with Chewie (or another of your scouts at an exterior site), may use 2 Force to cancel one opponent's battle destiny just drawn. Immune to attrition < 3.
lore: \b Scout\b0. \b Leader\b0  of the Rebel strike team on Endor. Needed the cleverness of a Corellian to destroy the Endor control bunker. Discovered the truth about Luke and Leia.
name: General Solo

gametext: Target two non-creature vehicles with maneuver (one yours, one opponent's) present at same site. Both players draw destiny, add your vehicle's maneuver to your total. Lowest total loses vehicle. OR Your speeder bike piloted by Luke or a scout adds one battle destiny.
lore: Versatility is key to the Rebellion. The Rebel's ability to adapt to any situation is well-known.
name: Get Alongside That One

gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each (Light Side Force icon) at same Endor site. When opponent is losing Force from Force drains at same or adjacent Endor site, lost Force must come from Reserve Deck if possible.
lore: Cunning Ewok. Led successful attacks, encircling enemies and cutting off their retreats.
name: Graak

gametext: If a battle that opponent initiated just ended, initiate a new battle at same location. 'Reacts' are allowed only for opponent, but cards may not 'react' away or hide from battle. Loser ignores battle damage. If your droid present there, add one battle destiny (two if C-3PO).
lore: C-3PO had been through enough battles that many of the Rebels in the strike team considered him a good luck charm. That isn't what Han considers him.
name: Here We Go Again

gametext: If opponent just initiated a battle where opponent has more than double your power, target your highest-ability character in that battle. Draw destiny. If destiny < target's ability, deploy one character there from hand (for free).
lore: "I'm rather embarrassed, General Solo, but it appears you are to be the main course at a banquet in my honor."
name: I Have A Really Bad Feeling About This

gametext: Deploy on table. Your non-unique scouts are forfeit +1. During every draw phase, unless opponent's character of destiny < 4 occupies a battleground site, opponent loses 1 Force. Effect canceled unless your characters of destiny < 4 occupy two battleground sites.
lore: "I'm afraid that Artoo's sensors can find no trace of Princess Leia."
name: I Hope She's All Right

gametext: If Leia and Han are in a battle together, add two battle destiny. OR If opponent just initiated a battle against Han, you may 'react' by deploying there (for free) Leia and/or her matching weapon from hand and/or Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
lore: Han and Leia chose unusual times to express their true feelings for each other.
name: I Know

gametext: Deploy on Han or your war room. Once during each of your deploy phases, may take one That's One, Count Me In or I'm With You Too into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While Han is at an exterior battleground site, he is immune to attrition < 4.
lore: "General Solo, is your strike team assembled?"
name: I Wonder Who They Found

gametext: Deploy on table. Unique (*) Rebels of ability < 3 are forfeit +2. Nabrun Leids and Elis Helrot are limited to owner's move phase and exterior sites. Once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one docking bay from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
lore: Rebel insurgents and local activists are the first step in breaking the Imperial stranglehold on a world.
name: Insurrection

gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each (Light Side Force icon) at same Endor site. When present at an Endor site, adds 1 to your Force drains at each Endor site where another of your Ewoks is present.
lore: Elder Ewok advisor to Chief Chirpa. Studied Imperial patrols and helped plan attacks.
name: Kazak

gametext: Adds 1 to each of his character weapon destiny draws (characters he 'hits' are forfeit -3). When firing an A280 Sharpshooter Rifle, may fire repeatedly at same target for 2 Force each time.
lore: \b Scout\b0. Famous guide who was recruited for Madine's commando unit from the forests of Kashyyyk. Sharpshooter who uses one of the BlasTech rifles brought by Corporal Janse.
name: Lieutenant Greeve

gametext: Adds 1 to each of your battle destiny draws when with Derlin, Cracken or Madine at a site (or when with at least two of your other scouts at an exterior planet site). Your Rebel scouts deploy -1 to same exterior site (except Rebel Landing Site).
lore: \b Scout\b0  who served under General Veers' command. Defected and was recruited for General Madine's commando organization. Works closely with Colonel Cracken.
name: Lieutenant Page

gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each (Light Side Force icon) at same Endor site. When on Endor, adds 1 to total battle destiny wherever you have any Ewok at an Endor site.
lore: Ewok tribal shaman and medicine man. \b Musician\b0. Wears the skull of a great Churi bird. Suspicious of outsiders. Revered for his wisdom.
name: Logray

gametext: Cancel a Force drain at an exterior planet site where opponent has no vehicles or starships. Draw destiny. If destiny > number of opponent's characters at that site, choose one of those characters to be missing.
lore: Survival training becomes essential when an Imperial scout trooper is separated from his speeder bike.
name: Lost In The Wilderness

gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each (Light Side Force icon) at same Endor site. When on Endor, adds 1 to total weapon destiny whenever you have any Ewok using an Ewok weapon at an Endor site.
lore: Ewok archer. Wood carver. Tribal elder that advises Chief Chirpa. Crafts and maintains weapons.
name: Lumat

gametext: While at your war room, subtracts 1 from each opponent's battle destiny at all system locations and adds 2 to forfeit of all non-unique Rebels. Once during each of your deploy phase, may deploy one non-unique Rebel from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
lore: Native of Chandrila. \b Leader\b0  of the Alliance. A former member of the Imperial Senate where she was a formidable opponent of then-Senator Palpatine. Friend of Bail Organa.
name: Mon Mothma

gametext: When Orrimaarko is in a battle you just won against an Imperial, opponent must lose 2 Force. Immune to attrition < 3 (or < 4 when present at a forest, jungle or exterior Endor site).
lore: Dresselian \b scout\b0  and resistance \b leader\b0. Worked tirelessly to combat the subjugation of his homeworld before Bothans brought him into contact with the Alliance.
name: Orrimaarko

gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each (Light Side Force icon) at same Endor site. May pilot only speeder bikes. Once during each of your control phases, may take one Free Ride into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
lore: Ewok \b scout\b0. Son of Warok. Brave, adventurous \b thief\b0. Stole an Imperial speeder bike to create a diversion. "Not bad for a little furball."
name: Paploo

gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each (Light Side Force icon) icon at same Endor site. Where present, may substitute for a character just selected to be attacked by a creature. When attacking or being attacked, power +2 and may add one destiny.
lore: Ewok. Tamer of beasts. \b Thief\b0. Loner. Hunter. Survivor.
name: Rabin

gametext: At the beginning of your deploy phase, if you occupy an Endor or Rebel Base site, deploy up to 5 troopers there from Reserve Deck (those troopers deploy -1) and reshuffle. You may not deploy any other characters or starships this turn.
lore: General Solo's strike team was made up of the Alliance's finest ground troops.
name: Rapid Deployment

gametext: [Front Side]: \ul Deploy Endor system and Rebel Landing Site.\ul0 \par \b While\b0  this side up, opponent loses no more than 1 Force from each of your Force drains at Endor locations. Once during each of your deploy phases, may use 2 Force to take one Bunker or Deactivate The Shield Generator into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. \par \b Flip\b0  this card if Bunker "blown away" or if, during your move phase, you control three exterior Endor sites (with two Rebel scouts at each). \par \b Place\b0  out of play if Endor "blown away."\\par[Back Side]: \b While\b0  this side up, at each Endor site where you have a Rebel scout, your Force drains may not be modified or canceled by opponent, except by a 'react'. Rebel scouts are immune to attrition < 4. Once during each of your draw phases, may retrieve one Rebel scout of ability < 3. Your Epic Event destiny draws are each +2. \par \b Flip\b0  this card (unless Bunker "blown away") if, during an opponent's move phase, opponent controls three exterior Endor sites or Endor system. \par \b Place\b0  out of play if Endor is "blown away."
name: Rebel Strike Team/Garrison Destroyed

gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each (Light Side Force icon) at same Endor site. When on Endor, adds 1 to your Force generation at each Endor site with an Ewok present.
lore: Proud Ewok \b scout\b0. Defended his tribe against the Empire's war machines and stormtroopers.
name: Romba

gametext: Landspeed = 2. Allows your other scouts present at same exterior site to move with him (using landspeed = 2) for free. Adds 1 to immunity to attrition of all your scouts present at same exterior site who have immunity.
lore: Veteran pathfinder. Defected with General Madine. Recruited as a \b scout\b0  for the newly-formed commando unit.
name: Sergeant Brooks Carlson

gametext: When opponent has just initiated a battle at same exterior site and all your ability here is provided by scouts, may reveal top card of Reserve Deck. If that card is a scout, may deploy it here for free (otherwise, replace on top of Reserve Deck).
lore: Corellian \b scout\b0  who served as point man for General Solo's strike team. Recruited by General Madine for the Alliance commando unit.
name: Sergeant Bruckman

gametext: When at Bunker, adds 1 to Deactivate The Shield Generator total for each Explosive Charge here. When Junkin uses a Concussion Grenade, all your characters are immune to that grenade and you may add or subtract 1 from weapon destiny draw.
lore: Demolitions expert and \b scout\b0. Supervises explosives preparations for covert operations. Consulted with General Madine to plan placement of explosives within control bunker.
name: Sergeant Junkin

gametext: USED: Use 1 Force to take into hand one vehicle, weapon or interrupt with 'Ewok' in the title from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. LOST: If your Ewok is defending a battle, add one battle destiny.
lore: Ewok warriors on patrol use primitive animal horns to coordinate their defenses.
name: Sound The Attack

gametext: May add 1 pilot and 1 passenger. May move as a 'react.' When piloted, vehicle and scouts aboard are immune to attrition < 4. Pilot's power = 0. If lost, characters aboard may "jump off" (disembark).
lore: Aratech speeder bikes often found their way into Rebel hands. Stolen from troops operating far from Imperial maintenance facilities.
name: Speeder Bike

gametext: Cancel Counter Assault. OR Use 4 Force to cancel opponent's Force drain at an exterior Endor site. Deploy (for free) from Reserve Deck any number of non-unique Ewoks to that site (Dark Side characters, vehicles, and starships here may 'escape' to Used Pile).
lore: Chief Chirpa led his Ewok warriors in a counterattack that captured many Imperial soldiers outside the Endor control bunker.
name: Surprise Counter Assault

gametext: USED: If all your ability in a battle is provided by scouts and/or spies, they each add 1 to your total battle destiny (limit +6). LOST: For remainder of turn, your unique (*) scouts and unique (*) spies are each power +1 (or +2 while being attacked by a creature).
lore: The ability to think and act indepedently gave the Rebels an advantage over their Imperial foes.
name: Take The Initiative

gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each (Light Side Force icon) at same Endor site. While on Endor, adds 1 (or 2 if present with Logray) to forfeit of each of your Ewoks at Endor sites.
lore: Ewok watcher of the stars. \b Musician\b0  and poet at heart. Wears a horned Gurreck skull decorated with Churi feathers. Carries a stone hatchet. Student of Logray.
name: Teebo

gametext: Deploy on Chewie. He is immune to attrition < 4 at exterior sites. Visored Vision is immune to Sense. While at same battleground site as Han, Chewie adds 1 to each of his weapon destiny draws and Life Debt is a Used Interrupt during a battle there.
lore: Considering the life debt he owed to Han and his personal commitment to the Rebel Alliance, Chewie quickly volunteered to fly the stolen shuttle to Endor.
name: That's One

gametext: If Han and Leia are present together at a battleground site (and neither is undercover), choose one of the following: Your Force drain is +1 at that site this turn. OR Opponent's Force drains at related locations are -1 next turn. OR Cancel This Is Still Wrong.
lore: "He's my brother."
name: This Is Absolutely Right

gametext: Deploys -2 on Endor. Adds 1 to attrition against opponent for each Ewok in battle at same site. If just lost from table during battle, may go to Used Pile. At same and related sites, [Cloud City], [Jabba's Palace], and [Endor] characters are immune to Bad Feeling Have I.
lore: Against his programming to impersonate a deity. Worshiped by the Ewoks. "Aaaahhhhh-uuuuhhhhh. Aaaahhhhh-uuuuhhhhh. Aaaahhhhh-uuuuhhhhh."
name: Threepio

gametext: Take one automated weapon into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Add 1 to Deactivate The Shield Generator total. OR Cancel Trooper Charge, Blasted Droid, Trooper Assault or Dark Jedi Presence.
lore: Han knew that it was urgent that he quickly finished his assignment.
name: Throw Me Another Charge

gametext: May deploy (and your characters may deploy aboard) even without presence of Force icons. May add 2 pilots and 6 passengers. While \ul Tydirium\ul0  is at a system location, your scouts deploy -1 aboard.
lore: Stolen Imperial Lambda-class shuttle. Supposedly carried parts and technical crew. Delivered General Solo's crack team of Rebel scouts to the forest moon of Endor.
name: Tydirium

gametext: USED: Take one or two communications or protocol droids (or one of each) into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. LOST: Retrieve C-3PO. OR If C-3PO is in battle at a site, add one battle destiny (or two if with three Ewoks).
lore: For the second time in the Endor mission, C-3PO saved the day.
name: Were You Looking For Me?

gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each (Light Side Force icon) at same Endor site. When in battle, may target one opponent's character present. Draw destiny. Target excluded from battle if destiny > ability.
lore: Ewok \b scout\b0. Son of Shodu and Deej. Found Leia and befriended her. Persuaded his tribe to help.
name: Wicket

gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on an Endor site where you have an Ewok. Moves like a character. Adds one (Light Side Force icon) while your Ewok is present. Effect lost if you initiate a battle here or opponent controls this location.
lore: Every Ewok is taught to be protective of the younger members of their clan.
name: Wokling

gametext: Add 1 to landspeed of your scout at an exterior planet site for remainder of turn. OR If Han is with Leia or Chewie in battle, draw one destiny and subtract it from opponent's attrition against you.
lore: Chewie felt right at home in the forests of Endor, which closely resemble the environment on his homeworld of Kashyyyk.
name: Wookiee Guide

gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each (Light Side Force icon) at same Endor site. Once during each of your deploy phases, if at an exterior Endor site, may use 2 Force to deploy an Endor site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
lore: Ewok explorer. \b Scout\b0. Searches for fallen trees to make tools. Tracks predators. First to notice the Imperial presence on Endor.
name: Wuta

gametext: May add 1 pilot, 2 passengers and 1 vehicle. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. Quad Laser Cannon and Surface Defense Cannon may deploy (and fire free) aboard.
lore: Reliable and durable. Widely used freighter made by Corellian Engineering Corporation. Sales have dramatically increased in porportion to the fame of Han Solo's ship.
name: YT-1300 Transport

gametext: USED: Adds 1 to forfeit of each of your Ewoks for remainder of turn. LOST: Retrieve one card with 'Ewok' in the title. OR Cancel Dead Ewok, Imperial Tyranny or Empire's New Order.
lore: "You're a jittery little thing, aren't you?"
name: Yub Yub!

gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your AT-ST. May target a character, creature or vehicle for 1 Force. Draw destiny. Add 1 if targeting a character or creature. Target hit if total destiny > defense value. May fire repeatedly for 2 Force each time.
lore: High rate of fire used for anti-personnel operations. Enhanced design from prototype used in the Battle of Hoth.
name: AT-ST Dual Cannon

gametext: Adds 2 to power of any combat vehicle he pilots. When piloting an AT-ST in battle, adds 1 to his forfeit, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise and \b cumulatively\b0  adds 1 to your attrition against opponent.
lore: Due to the unstable control characteristics of AT-STs, only the most talented recruits are assigned to them.
name: AT-ST Pilot

gametext: Adds 2 to maneuver, 1 to power and 1 to landspeed of either your speeder bike piloted by a biker scout or your swoop for remainder of turn. (Interrupt may even affect the result just after a destiny draw targeting the vehicle's maneuver.)
lore: The Empire trains its personnel to operate a variety of specialized equipment in demanding environments. This training allows troops to take seemingly risky actions.
name: Accelerate

gametext: Cancel a Force drain at an exterior planet site where opponent has no vehicles or starships. Draw destiny. If destiny > number of opponent's characters at that site, choose one of those characters to be missing.
lore: When Rebels get separated from their means of transportation, they lose effectiveness.
name: Always Thinking With Your Stomach

gametext: Deploy on your side of table. Stormtroopers (except biker scouts) have armor = 4. Also, your blaster rifles, Stormtrooper Utility Belts and Blaster Scopes are deploy -1 and are destiny +2 when drawn for weapon or battle destiny. (Immune to Alter.)
lore: Stormtrooper standard gear includes plastoid composite armor, utility belt, positive-grip boots and energy sinks to dissipate blaster fire.
name: An Entire Legion Of My Best Troops

gametext: Deploy on Carida system. Your speeder bikes piloted by biker scouts are power +1 and forfeit +1 and may follow (for free) an opponent's vehicle or character that just moved from same site (if within range). (Immune to Alter while you occupy Carida.)
lore: Aratech Corporation sent support staff to various Imperial outposts and garrisons. Gave advanced briefings and training to biker scout personnel.
name: Aratech Corporation

gametext: Deploy on table. You may initiate battles for free. Also (unless Battle Plan on table), for either player to initiate a Force drain, that player must first use 3 Force unless that player occupies a battleground site (except a holosite) and a battleground system. (Immune to Alter.)
lore: Administration of the Imperial installation on Endor includes coordination of troops on the ground and tight security provided by the Empire's space fleet.
name: Battle Order

gametext: Deploy on your side of table. Biker scouts have armor = 3 and are immune to Scramble. Also, Scout Blaster, Comlink, DH-17 blaster and Blaster Rack deploy for free and are destiny +2 when drawn for weapon or battle destiny. (Immune to Alter.)
lore: Standard-issue equipment for Imperial biker scouts. Adds electromagnetic vision enhancement visor and boosted comlink. Protects with lightweight head and upper body armor.
name: Biker Scout Gear

characteristics: \b biker scout trooper\b0, \b stormtrooper\b0, \b trooper\b0, \b scout\b0
gametext: Adds 3 to power of any speeder bike he pilots. Power -1 while not at a forest, jungle or Endor site. Forfeit +2 aboard a speeder bike. Once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy a speeder bike to same site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
lore: \b Scout\b0  troopers, or 'biker scouts' as they are commonly called, are stormtrooper specialists. Given wide latitude to operate independently of Imperial control.
name: Biker Scout Trooper

dark_side_text: If you occupy, once during each of your control phases, you may lose 1 Force to retrieve one trooper into hand.
gametext: Force drain -1 here. If you do not occupy, all your troopers are forfeit -1.   If you occupy, once during each of your control phases, you may lose 1 Force to retrieve one trooper into hand.
light_side_text: Force drain -1 here. If you do not occupy, all your troopers are forfeit -1.
name: Carida

gametext: Deploy on Back Door. Opponent may not deploy or move to Bunker. Effect canceled if opponent controls Back Door or Landing Platform or if you intitiate a Force drain at Bunker. (Immune to Alter.)
lore: Double durasteel doors are often enough to protect important Imperial installations.
name: Closed Door

gametext: While at Bunker or an Endor battleground site, prevents Ominous Rumors from being canceled. Your [Endor] troopers may move as a 'react' to same site.
lore: Responsible for defense of control bunker. \b Leader\b0. Worked closely with Moff Jerjerrod to plan the installation's defense. Instructed to hold troops in reserve.
name: Colonel Dyer

gametext: USED: If a battle was just initiated, draw destiny and activate up to that much Force. STARTING: If you have not deployed an Objective, deploy from Reserve Deck one battleground site (or two <> sites) related to your starting location. Place Interrupt in Reserve Deck.
lore: Imperial troops remain prepared for quick deployment to seize valuable terrain.
name: Combat Readiness

gametext: Adds 3 to power of any combat vehicle he pilots. When piloting Tempest 1 or a non-unique AT-AT, adds one battle destiny. When in battle with Veers or Tagge, may use 2 Force to cancel and redraw one just-drawn battle destiny.
lore: \b Leader\b0. Served with General Veers' Blizzard unit at Battle of Hoth. Assigned by Vader to coordinate surface defense of Endor's moon. Kuat native.
name: Commander Igar

gametext: If your warrior just fired a DH-17 blaster or scout blaster during a battle, draw destiny: (0) no effect, (1-3) target may not use weapons this turn, (4+) target is power and forfeit = 0 this battle.
lore: The small blasters used by biker scouts can be fired when piloting a vehicle at high speed.
name: Compact Firepower

characteristics: \b biker scout trooper\b0, \b stormtrooper\b0, \b trooper\b0, \b scout\b0
gametext: Adds 3 to power of any speeder bike he pilots (when piloting it in battle, also adds 1 to your total battle destiny). When in a Local Trouble battle, adds one destiny to your total power.
lore: Frequently engaged in brawls at the local enlisted clubs on homeworld of Corulag. Stormtrooper assigned to biker \b scout\b0  unit. Monitors Yuzzum activity.
name: Corporal Avarik

gametext: Once during each of your control phases, may take one Special Delivery into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Special Delivery is immune to Alter. When Drazin completes Special Delivery, you may take two additional cards into hand.
lore: Stormtrooper assigned to Commander Igar's honor guard. Accompanied Vader on Drazin's homeworld of Bespin. Shot C-3PO there.
name: Corporal Drazin

characteristics: \b biker scout trooper\b0, \b stormtrooper\b0, \b trooper\b0, \b scout\b0
gametext: Adds 3 to power of any speeder bike he pilots or anything he drives. When in battle with Irol at a site, adds one battle destiny. Power +1 at any mobile, interior or spaceport site.
lore: Stormtrooper from Coruscant. Honed piloting skills by racing swoops in underworld of Imperial capital. Still tempering his skills as a biker \b scout\b0.
name: Corporal Drelosyn

characteristics: \b biker scout trooper\b0, \b stormtrooper\b0, \b trooper\b0, \b scout\b0
gametext: Adds 3 to power of any speeder bike he pilots. When firing a Scout Blaster, adds 1 to his total weapon destiny. When with Barich in a battle and piloting or driving a vehicle, may add that vehicle's maneuver to your total power.
lore: Son of a Tatooine diplomat. Stormtrooper. Biker \b scout\b0. Deadly shot. Develops speeder bike tactics with Sergeant Barich. Hopes for promotion to Emperor's Demonstration Team.
name: Corporal Misik

characteristics: ISB agent, \b biker scout trooper\b0, \b stormtrooper\b0, \b trooper\b0, \b scout\b0
gametext: Adds 3 to power of any speeder bike he pilots. Once during each of your control phases, may target one opponent's missing character at same site. Draw destiny. Add 2 if Oberk is armed with a blaster. Target captured if total destiny > ability.
lore: Originally from Ukio. Stormtrooper assigned to search for Rebel activity on Endor. Trying to impress the commander of his biker \b scout\b0  detachment.
name: Corporal Oberk

gametext: If a battle that opponent initiated just ended, initiate a new battle at same location. 'Reacts' are allowed only for opponent, but cards may not 'react' away or hide from battle. Loser ignores battle damage. If your trooper present there, add one battle destiny.
lore: The Imperial forces on Endor quickly responded to the Rebel intrusion. Commander Igar had a plan in place to deal with such a commando force of Rebels.
name: Counterattack

gametext: Deploy on table. When you fire two weapons (except lightsabers) in a battle, your total power is +5. Also, S-foils and Maneuvering Flaps are suspended where you have either a weapon present or a starship (or vehicle) with maneuver > 3 present. (Immune to Alter.)
lore: Scout walker pilots are trained to set up a deadly heavy fire zone. This tactic can be disrupted by enemy weapons fire.
name: Crossfire

gametext: Reduce any alien's forfeit to 0 for remainder of turn. OR If you have two Imperials present at a site, draw destiny. Add 1 for each of your blasters present. If total destiny > number of Ewoks present at same site, those Ewoks are lost.
lore: Many Ewoks gave their lives in the Battle of Endor.
name: Dead Ewok

gametext: If a battle was just initiated, and two of your troopers are armed with weapons, target one opponent's character present. Draw destiny: (0-2) no effect; (3-4) target is power = 0 for remainder of turn; (5+) target captured.
lore: Stormtroopers rely on an intimidating presence and technologically superiority.
name: Don't Move

gametext: Deploy on an interior site that has a Scomp link. While you occupy this site, once per battle you may deploy a non-unique Imperial starship as a 'react' (for free if a starfighter) to the related system from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
lore: Listening posts are often constructed as part of a standard Imperial installation. On Endor, such a post was incorporated into the control bunker.
name: Early Warning Network

gametext: USED: For remainder of turn, subtract 1 from forfeit of each opponent's Ewok (or subtract 2 from any one opponent's character). LOST: Cancel one Ewok's game text for remainder of turn. OR Cancel Sound The Attack.
lore: Paploo's brave diversion provided more of a ride than the adventurous Ewok had bargained for.
name: Eee Chu Wawa!

gametext: Power +2 while armed with a blaster. When using a blaster, subtracts 1 from Force required to fire it. Adds 2 to forfeit of each stormtrooper of ability < 2 at same site.
lore: Commander Igar selected the Empire's most dedicated stormtroopers to guard Endor for the Emperor. All they know is killing and white uniforms.
name: Elite Squadron Stormtrooper

gametext: Deploy on table. Droid Merchant game text is canceled. Also, while none of your ability on table is provided by aliens, retrieve 1 Force after each battle in which opponent's alien is lost (or 2 if Ewok, Elom or operative). (Immune to Alter.)
lore: Palpatine's cruel vision of his Empire included the enslavement and subjugation of entire species.
name: Empire's New Order

dark_side_text: If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Endor sites.
gametext: If you have no Ewoks on Endor, Force drain -1 here. To move or deploy your starship to here requires +1 Force.   If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Endor sites.
light_side_text: If you have no Ewoks on Endor, Force drain -1 here. To move or deploy your starship to here requires +1 Force.
name: Endor

gametext: Cancel Tatooine Celebration, Cloud City Celebration or Coruscant Celebration. (Immune to Sense.) OR During your activate phase, activate 1 Force for each Endor battleground you occupy.
lore: Each planet controlled by the Empire drains potential resources from the Rebel Alliance.
name: Endor Occupation

gametext: [Front Side]: \ul Deploy Endor system, Bunker and Landing Platform.\ul0 \par \b While\b0  this side up, once during each of your control phases, may take one Ominous Rumors or Establish Secret Base into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. \par \b Flip\b0  this card if Ominous Rumors and Establish Secret Base are both on table. \par \b Place\b0  out of play if an Endor location is "blown away."\\par[Back Side]: \b While\b0  this side up, at each Endor site where you have a biker scout or a piloted AT-ST, your Force drains may not be modified or canceled by opponent, except by a 'react'. Opponent draws no more than one battle destiny in each battle. Your AT-STs are immune to attrition < 3. Once during each of your draw phases, you may retrieve one biker scout. \par \b Flip\b0  this card if Ominous Rumors and Establish Secret Base are not both on table. \par \b Place\b0  out of play if an Endor location is "blown away."
name: Endor Operations/Imperial Outpost

dark_side_text: Your aliens are deploy -1 here (or -2 if Yuzzum). If your Yuzzum present, Force drain +1 here.
gametext: Your aliens are deploy -1 here (or -2 if Yuzzum). If your Yuzzum present, Force drain +1 here.
name: Endor: Ancient Forest

dark_side_text: During your move phase, you may move from Back Door to Bunker (or vice versa).
gametext: If you control, during your move phase, you may move from Back Door to Bunker (or vice versa).   During your move phase, you may move from Back Door to Bunker (or vice versa).
light_side_text: If you control, during your move phase, you may move from Back Door to Bunker (or vice versa).
name: Endor: Back Door

dark_side_text: Once per game, you may deploy Endor Shield from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
gametext: You may move here only from Back Door. While you control, Endor Shield is suspended.   Once per game, you may deploy Endor Shield from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
light_side_text: You may move here only from Back Door. While you control, Endor Shield is suspended.
name: Endor: Bunker

dark_side_text: Your Yuzzum are each power +1 here. If your Imperial is present, Force drain +1 here.
gametext: Your Ewoks are each deploy +1 here. If your Ewok present, Force drain +1 here.   Your Yuzzum are each power +1 here. If your Imperial is present, Force drain +1 here.
light_side_text: Your Ewoks are each deploy +1 here. If your Ewok present, Force drain +1 here.
name: Endor: Dark Forest

dark_side_text: No starships or vehicles here except speeder bikes, AT-STs, Ewok gliders and creature vehicles.
gametext: No starships or vehicles here except speeder bikes, AT-STs, Ewok gliders and creature vehicles.   No starships or vehicles here except speeder bikes, AT-STs, Ewok gliders and creature vehicles.
light_side_text: No starships or vehicles here except speeder bikes, AT-STs, Ewok gliders and creature vehicles.
name: Endor: Dense Forest

dark_side_text: No starships or vehicles here. If no Ewoks on Endor, Force drain +1 here.
gametext: No starships or vehicles here. If your Ewok present, Force drain +1 here.   No starships or vehicles here. If no Ewoks on Endor, Force drain +1 here.
light_side_text: No starships or vehicles here. If your Ewok present, Force drain +1 here.
name: Endor: Ewok Village

dark_side_text: Your vehicles are each power +1 here. Force Drain +1 here.
gametext: Your vehicles are each power +1 here.   Your vehicles are each power +1 here. Force Drain +1 here.
light_side_text: Your vehicles are each power +1 here.
name: Endor: Forest Clearing

dark_side_text: Your character movement from here (except for Yuzzum and scouts) requires +1 landspeed.
gametext: Your character movement from here (except for Ewoks and scouts) requires +1 landspeed.   Your character movement from here (except for Yuzzum and scouts) requires +1 landspeed.
light_side_text: Your character movement from here (except for Ewoks and scouts) requires +1 landspeed.
name: Endor: Great Forest

dark_side_text: Your docking bay transit from here requires 1 Force (free if your Imperial present).
gametext: Your docking bay transit from here requires 7 Force. Your transit to here requires +9 Force.   Your docking bay transit from here requires 1 Force (free if your Imperial present).
light_side_text: Your docking bay transit from here requires 7 Force. Your transit to here requires +9 Force.
name: Endor: Landing Platform (Docking Bay)

gametext: Deploy on Endor system if your biker scouts and/or AT-STs control three Endor sites. Your Force drain here is +1 for each Endor site your biker scout or AT-ST controls (limit +3). Place Effect in Used Pile if opponent controls this system. (Immune to Alter.)
lore: The Empire's remote bases develop new technology and hide sensitive projects from potential Rebel saboteurs.
name: Establish Secret Base

gametext: If a Rebel just deployed or moved to a site where you have a trooper present armed with a weapon, use 1 Force. For remainder of turn, that Rebel may not battle or move and battle damage against you is limited to 4 at that location.
lore: Despite Wicket's warnings, an Imperial scout still got the drop on Leia.
name: Freeze!

gametext: If opponent just initiated a battle at an exterior site with double your total power, reveal top 3 cards of your Reserve Deck. If any of those cards are scouts or speeder bikes, deploy them for free to that battle (replaces others on top of Reserve Deck in same order).
lore: When confronted with enemy troops, biker scouts are instructed to immediately call for reinforcements.
name: Go For Help!

gametext: Target two non-creature vehicles with maneuver (one yours, one opponent's) present at same site. Both players draw destiny; add your vehicle's maneuver to your total. Lowest total loses vehicle. OR Your speeder bike piloted by a biker scout adds one battle destiny.
lore: Biker scouts train relentlessly on their speeder bikes to ensure that their speed advantage is a potent weapon. This training includes high-velocity brawling.
name: High-speed Tactics

gametext: USED: If opponent's card present with your vehicle of landspeed > 2 has just begun to move as a 'react', cancel that 'react'. LOST: Select one opponent's vehicle present with your vehicle of landspeed > 2 to be power = 0 for remainder of turn.
lore: The mobility of speeder bikes is greatly valued by the Empire's advanced scout detachments.
name: Hot Pursuit

gametext: Deploy on your side of table. Each of your non-unique Imperials armed with a non-unique blaster is forfeit +2, adds 1 to his total weapon destiny and, where present, \b cumulatively\b0  adds 1 to total battle destiny. (Immune to Alter while your non-unique blaster is on table.)
lore: Graduates of the Empire's military academies train to fire standard-issue weapons efficiently.
name: Imperial Academy Training

gametext: Deploy on table. Unique (*) Imperials of ability < 3 are forfeit +2. Nabrun Leids and Elis Helrot are limited to owner's move phase and exterior sites. Once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one docking bay from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
lore: When an Imperial blockade raises the alert level, all independent ships are scanned and any suspicious characters on planet are detained and interrogated.
name: Imperial Arrest Order

gametext: If an opponent's alien is defending a battle against your non-unique Imperial, add one battle destiny. If an opponent's Ewok, Elom or operative is defending, also add 3 to your total power. OR Add 2 to your total weapon destiny when targeting a non-unique alien.
lore: The Empire considers alien species to be inferior.
name: Imperial Tyranny

gametext: USED: If opponent just landed a starship at an exterior site, you may deploy up to three related sites from your Reserve Deck; reshuffle. LOST: Use 2 Force to 'scan' (reveal) opponent's hand. You may place one starship you find there in opponent's Used Pile.
lore: Even though Vader allowed the stolen shuttle \ul Tydirium\ul0  to land on Endor, he had a plan to deal with the Rebels.
name: It's An Older Code

gametext: Deploy -1 if Sienar Fleet Systems on table. May add 1 pilot and 6 passengers. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. Takes off and lands for free.
lore: Manufactured by Sienar Fleet Systems. Length 20 meters. Bottom wings fold for docking and landing. Boarding ramp allows easy access to passenger and cargo areas.
name: Lambda-Class Shuttle

gametext: Deploys free aboard Blizzard Scout 1. Adds 2 to power of any combat vehicle he pilots (or 3 if an AT-ST). When piloting Tempest Scout 1, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. Opponent may not 'react' to or from same site.
lore: Veteran AT-ST pilot assigned to coordinate the surprise counterattack in the Battle of Endor. Commanded a prototype AT-ST in General Veers' assault upon Hoth.
name: Lieutenant Arnet

gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots or any swoop he drives. When in battle at an exterior site, adds 2 to attrition against opponent for each of your biker scout/trooper (non-biker scout) pairs present.
lore: Colonel Dyer's aide. Coordinates \b scout\b0  actions. As a youth, raced swoops on homeworld of Corellia. Formerly served with Emperor's Demonstration Team.
name: Lieutenant Grond

gametext: Power +2 while present with a stormtrooper. You Rebel Scum targeting a Rebel at same site is a Used Interrupt and is immune to Sense. Immune to attrition < number of stormtroopers present.
lore: \b Leader\b0  of one of the Emperor's finest legions of troops. His command was placed at the disposal of Colonel Dyer. Always on the lookout for Rebel activity.
name: Lieutenant Renz

gametext: Adds 2 to power of any combat vehicle he pilots. Adds 1 to each weapon destiny draw of any combat vehicle he pilots (or 2 if on Tempest Scout 2 or if present with Marquand).
lore: Native of Corulag. Watts' gunnery skills produce devastating results. Temporarily assigned to Kuat Drive Yards to work on prototype AT-ST weaponry.
name: Lieutenant Watts

gametext: USED: Cancel Frozen Assets. (Immune to Sense.) LOST: If opponent's alien and Rebel are in battle together without a protocol droid, draw one destiny (or two if Rebel is Han) and subtract that amount from opponent's attrition and total power.
lore: Threepio always tried to be polite to Captain Solo and to keep him from getting hot under the collar.
name: Main Course

gametext: Adds 1 to total power for each of your troopers present at same site. When on Endor, subtracts 1 from total for Deactivate The Shield Generator and your troopers are forfeit +1 on Endor. When at Bunker, allows Imperials to deploy there as a 'react'.
lore: \b Leader\b0  of Navy detachment assigned to guard the Endor control bunker. Liaison between Imperial technicians and command staff.
name: Major Hewex

gametext: Adds 3 to power of any combat vehicle he pilots. When piloting a combat vehicle with Watts, may add one battle destiny and, if that vehicle has immunity to attrition, adds 2 to immunity.
lore: Directed a counterattack against the Ewoks on Endor. Formerly crewed an AT-AT assigned to \ul Devastator\ul0. Originally from Kessel.
name: Major Marquand

gametext: Deploy -1 to a mobile site (except on Cloud City). When defending a battle, power +1 (or +2 if also at an interior site). When in battle against an operative, prevents opponent from drawing more than one battle destiny.
lore: Navy troopers are assigned to defend key installations. Trained to protect against alien speciees and other insurgents.
name: Navy Trooper

gametext: Subtracts 3 from Force opponent retrieves for On The Edge and Off The Edge. When at Bunker, adds 2 to deploy cost of each opponent's character (except Ewoks, spies and scouts) to Endor sites (except Rebel Landing Site).
lore: Rendili native skilled at close-quarters combat. Worked with Trooper Vesden to monitor enemy activity on Endor.
name: Navy Trooper Fenson

gametext: Forfeit +2 while with Hewex. When at Bunker (or aboard a Star Destroyer at Endor), \b cumulatively\b0  adds 1 to deploy cost of each opponent's starship and non-Ewok vehicle deploying to Endor (or to your mobile site orbiting Endor).
lore: Many Imperial Navy troopers receive technical as well as combat training, which they use to maintain the Empire's military facilities.
name: Navy Trooper Shield Technician

gametext: If present with a Scomp link when Never Tell Me The Odds just reached the top of your Reserve Deck, may 'shield' (add 3 to destiny number of) one of your characters at each location for remainder of turn.
lore: Counterintelligence agent assigned by ISB. Operates sensors designed to protect the control bunker from infiltration.
name: Navy Trooper Vesden

gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on Endor system if opponent controls no Endor sites. Your Force drains are +2 at up to X other battleground systems, where X = number of Endor sites you occupy. Effect canceled if opponent controls three Endor sites. (Immune to Alter.)
lore: Rumors of a new 'technological terror' filled the galaxy with dread.
name: Ominous Rumors

gametext: During a battle, if you have weapons at at least 2 sites adjacent to that battle, add 3 to your total power and add one battle destiny. OR For remainder of turn, your biker scout at an exterior site is power +1 and adds 1 to each of that character's weapon destiny draws.
lore: Commander Igar's defense of Endor called for the use of speeder bikes to harass any attacking Rebels.
name: Outflank

gametext: Deploy on Bunker. While you control Bunker, each time opponent deploys a vehicle, starship or Rebel to an Endor site (except Rebel Landing Site), that card cannot move or battle for remainder of turn and opponent must lose 1 Force. (Immune to Alter.)
lore: Heavy Imperial patrols on Endor forced the Rebels to deploy covertly. The required stealth measures created many complications.
name: Perimeter Patrol

gametext: Deploy on your side of table. Opponent may not 'react' away from a battle where you have a blaster present. Also, if you have a blaster present when opponent cancels a battle, draw destiny, opponent loses Force equal to destiny draw. (Immune to Alter.)
lore: Heavy blaster fire hampered Han's attempts to open the Back Door to the Endor control bunker.
name: Pinned Down

gametext: If your scout is battling opponent's scout, spy or operative, add one battle destiny. OR If you have a spy or scout at Bunker or any prison, place out of play one captured spy of ability < 3 or captured operative there. Retrieve Force equal to double that captive's forfeit.
lore: The Emperor's defense of the forest moon of Endor appeared to work with devastating effectiveness.
name: Pitiful Little Band

gametext: Deploy on opponent's non-droid character at same or adjacent site as your scout. During each of your control phases, if your scout is at this site (and not Undercover), opponent loses 2 Force (or 3 Force if that scout is also a biker scout).
lore: Biker scouts commonly work as a team to track enemies of the Empire. A pair of scouts on speeder bike is difficult to elude.
name: Relentless Tracking

gametext: Deploy on your biker scout, or use 2 Force to deploy on your other warrior. May deploy as a 'react'. May target a character or creature using 1 Force (for free if fired by your spy or scout). Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny > defense value.
lore: Hold-out blaster utilized by Imperial scouts. Small size limits range, but concealability is often an asset.
name: Scout Blaster

gametext: Add 1 to landspeed of your scout at an exterior planet site for remainder of turn. OR If Igar is with Grond or Dyer in battle, draw one destiny and subtract if from opponent's attrition against you.
lore: Familiarity with native terrain is essential to a scout garrison. Imperial command can also put this type of information to effective use.
name: Scout Recon

gametext: Deploy on table. Biker scouts are forfeit +1. During every draw phase, unless opponent's character of destiny < 4 occupies a battleground site, opponent loses 1 Force. Effect canceled unless your characters of destiny < 4 occupy two battleground sites.
lore: Imperial troops searched the forests of Endor to flush the Rebels out.
name: Search And Destroy

gametext: Deploy on a location. Your Force generation is +1 here. Also, if you 'probe' opponent's "Hidden Base" system, opponent loses X Force, where X = 15 - number of systems on table. You take no battle damage where you have a 'probe' card. (Immune to Alter.)
lore: "I think I got it."
name: Security Precautions

characteristics: \b biker scout trooper\b0, \b stormtrooper\b0, \b trooper\b0, \b scout\b0
gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots (or 3 to any speeder bike). When in a battle with your other biker scout, may draw one destiny and subtract that amount from opponent's attrition and total power.
lore: Wakeelmui native. Former employee of Sienar Fleet Systems missile division. Stormtrooper biker \b scout\b0  with dreams of transferring to 181st Imperial Fighter Group.
name: Sergeant Barich

characteristics: \b biker scout trooper\b0, \b stormtrooper\b0, \b trooper\b0, \b scout\b0
gametext: Adds 3 to power of any speeder bike he pilots. When in battle with Avarik, adds 2 to your total battle destiny. When forfeited at same site as your other biker scout, also satisfies all remaining attrition and battle damage against you.
lore: Stormtrooper biker \b scout\b0. Kuat native. Avarik's partner since graduation from Corulag academy. Often forced to cover for partner's rash decisions.
name: Sergeant Elsek

characteristics: \b biker scout trooper\b0, \b stormtrooper\b0, \b trooper\b0, \b scout\b0
gametext: May deploy -1 as a 'react' to any forest, jungle or exterior Endor site. Adds 3 to power of any speeder bike he pilots. When vehicle he drives or pilots is targeted by High-speed Tactics or Get Alongside That One, adds 2 to your destiny draw.
lore: Cocky stormtrooper from an Outer Rim forest planet. Confident biker \b scout\b0  and hunter. Relies on superior balance and strength to operate his speeder bike.
name: Sergeant Irol

gametext: While Tarl is the trooper targeted by Spice Mines of Kessel, that Utinni Effect is immune to Alter and Tarl adds 4 to Force retrieved when completed. Subtracts 3 from Force opponent retrieves with Noble Sacrifice.
lore: Took part in the capture of the Rebel Blockade Runner \ul Tantive IV\ul0. Stormtrooper trained on Corulag. Corellia native.
name: Sergeant Tarl

gametext: May deploy for free to a battle you just initiated at a battleground site.
lore: Stormtrooper assigned to Colonel Dyer's command. His unit was recommended to Commander Igar by Governor Yount of the Wakeelmui garrison.
name: Sergeant Wallen

gametext: USED:If all of your ability in a battle is provided by scouts and/or spies, they each add 1 to your total battle destiny (limit +6). LOST: For remainder of turn, your unique (*) scouts and unique (*) spies are each power +1 (or +2 while being attacked by a creature).
lore: Imperial training allows scouts to use speed and stealth to their advantage. On Endor, they were also backed up by Commander Igar's AT-STs.
name: Sneak Attack

gametext: May add 1 pilot and 1 passenger. May move as a 'react.' When piloted, vehicle and scouts aboard are immune to attrition < 4. Pilot's power = 0. If lost, characters aboard may "jump off" (disembark).
lore: Aratech 74-Z military model. Preferred by troops operating far from Imperial maintenance facilities. Flight ceiling of 25 meters.
name: Speeder Bike

gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your speeder bike, 2 on your swoop. Vehicle is power +2. May target a character, creature or vehicle for free. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny +1 > defense value.
lore: Used for strafing runs during hit and fade tactics. Often difficult to target for an inexperienced pilot.
name: Speeder Bike Cannon

gametext: May add 1 pilot and 8 passengers. Immune to attrition < 4. Landspeed may not be increased. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. Each of its weapon destiny draws is +1.
lore: Command vehicle for Commander Igar. Uses an adapted TIE targeting system to combat maneuverable T-47s. Utilized in the subjugation of Kashyyyk. \b Enclosed\b0.
name: Tempest 1

gametext: May add 1 pilot or passenger. May move as a 'react' for 1 additional Force. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. Your Elite Squadron stormtroopers are deploy -1 to same site.
lore: Manufactured by Kuat Drive Yards under the close supervision of the Empire. Often used in conjunction with AT-ATs in an anti-personnel role. \b Enclosed\b0.
name: Tempest Scout

gametext: May add 2 pilots or passengers. May move as a 'react' for free. When Arnet piloting, immune to attrition < 4 and adds 1 to attrition against opponent here.
lore: \b Enclosed\b0  AT-ST assigned as first response to incidents at Endor control bunker. Piloted by Lieutenant Arnet.
name: Tempest Scout 1

gametext: Deploy -1 to Endor. May add 2 pilots or passengers. May move as a 'react'. Immune to attrition < 3 when Marquand piloting. Your scouts may move here as a 'react.'
lore: AT-ST assigned to coordinate battle activities with the Endor biker scout detachment. \b Enclosed\b0. First saw battle in Kashyyyk forests.
name: Tempest Scout 2

gametext: May deploy or move as a 'react' to a forest or Endor site. May add 1 pilot or passenger. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2.
lore: \b Enclosed\b0. Assigned to the task of searching for potential Rebel traps. Modified to help cover more territory to accomplish this task.
name: Tempest Scout 3

gametext: May add 1 pilot or passenger. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. AT-ST Dual Cannon deploys free aboard and may target at an adjacent site.
lore: \b Enclosed\b0  vehicle. Equipped with a prototype targeting computer. Maintains accuracy even in dense foliage. Energy diverted from propulsion to weapons systems.
name: Tempest Scout 4

gametext: May add 1 pilot or passenger. May move as a 'react.' Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. Adds 1 to your total power in battle at same site for each of your other piloted combat vehicles present.
lore: Uses experimental command and control software to coordinate combat data. \b Enclosed\b0.
name: Tempest Scout 5

gametext: May deploy -2 as a 'react.' May move as a 'react' for free. Permanent pilots provide total ability of 2.
lore: \b Enclosed\b0. Modified for perimeter patrol. Elite crew trained for many months over heavily forested terrain.
name: Tempest Scout 6

gametext: Deploy on your general or commander. When battling, adds 1 to your total battle destiny (or 2 if Igar). Once during each of your control phases, may take one Imperial Propaganda into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Your Force drains are +1 at holosites.
lore: Imperial officers often simulate large-scale battles with hologram games to improve their tactical ability. Those who excel at these games often mark themselves for advancement.
name: Well-earned Command

gametext: Cancel Leia's game text for remainder of turn. OR If your weapon (except a lightsaber) just 'hit' an opponent's character, for remainder of turn that character is power = 0 and may not apply ability toward drawing battle destiny.
lore: "Oh, Princess Leia, are you all right?"
name: Wounded Warrior

gametext: For remainder of turn, cancel game text of one Rebel present with two stormtroopers. OR During your control phase, cancel game text of one non-unique Rebel for remainder of turn.
lore: Imperial troops treat members of the Rebellion with disdain, showing little respect for their combat skills.
name: You Rebel Scum
